content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Go to the Plus section of Cambridge Dictionary, find Image quizzes and do an easy quiz about Animals and tell me your final score.  Please interact with https://dictionary.cambridge.org/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot indicates that a privacy consent dialogue is open on the Cambridge Dictionary website. I need to accept cookies to proceed. Therefore, I should click the "I Accept" button to move forward and then navigate to the +Plus section to find the image quizzes about Animals.

Action: Click 2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows the Cambridge Dictionary homepage, including a navigation bar with options like Dictionary, Translate, Grammar, Thesaurus, and the +Plus section. The element labeled as [5] is the +Plus Cambridge Dictionary +Plus section, which I need to click to access the image quizzes. Therefore, I will click that section.

Action: Click 5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The webpage shows various sections of the Cambridge Dictionary +Plus. The most relevant element for accessing the image quizzes appears to be the element labeled [21], which suggests content options. I will scroll down to explore further content available related to quizzes, likely where the image quizzes about animals would be found.

Action: Scroll 21; down
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot demonstrates that I am on the Cambridge Dictionary +Plus section, but it does not clearly show the image quizzes or any options related to animals directly. The item labeled [21] indicates "Contents," which likely holds the links to various quizzes and activities. Clicking this element may allow me to find the image quizzes for animals.

Action: Click 21
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot displays the +Plus menu of the Cambridge Dictionary, highlighting various options available. The element labeled [3] contains the option "Image quizzes," which is what I need to select in order to access the animal quizzes. I will click on this element to proceed to the image quizzes.

Action: Click 3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows the Cambridge Dictionary +Plus section with a focus on image quizzes, specifically listing animal images. The element labeled [23] is titled "Image quizzes," with related options for difficulty levels like "Easy" and "Not so easy." I need to click on the "Easy" quiz related to animals, which is most likely available right beneath this section, labeled as [24] since the images for that quiz are displayed there.

Action: Click 24
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot reveals that I am currently taking the Easy Animal Quiz on the Cambridge Dictionary +Plus section. I can see the question regarding which word matches the image of an elephant. The current score is shown as 0 out of 6. To answer the question, I need to select the appropriate answer associated with the image. The answer option "elephant" is clearly visible and is highlighted for selection. I will click on the element labeled [26] to select this answer.

Action: Click 26
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows that I am currently answering an Easy Quiz on Animals in the Cambridge Dictionary +Plus section. The score is displayed as 1 out of 6, indicating I have answered one question. The question asks, "Which word matches the image?" with a lion presented in the image and the correct answer ("lion") available for selection. To answer this question and proceed to the next one, I'll click the "Next" button labeled as [26].

Action: Click 26
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows the Cambridge Dictionary +Plus section with an Easy Animals Quiz currently in progress. The score reads 1 out of 6 questions answered correctly. The image displayed is that of a sheep, with the answer "sheep" available for selection. To move to the next question, I should click the "Next" button labeled as [26]. This will allow me to answer the next question in the quiz.

Action: Click 26

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[1]: "Dictionary";	[2]: "Translate";	[3]: "Grammar";	[4]: "Thesaurus";	[5]: "+Plus Cambridge Dictionary +Plus";	[10]: "Log in";	[11]: "Sign up";	[13]: "English (UK)";	[14]: <input> "Search";	[16]: <button> "English", "Choose a dictionary";	[17]: <button> "Search";	[18]: "Grammar", "Set dictionary search to Grammar";	[19]: "English–French", "Set dictionary search to English–French";	[20]: "French–English", "Set dictionary search to French–English";	[23]: "+Plus";	[24]: "Image quizzes";	[25]: <button> "Go back", "Previous question";	[26]: <button> "Next", "Next question";	[27]: "horse";	[28]: "Sign up";	[29]: "Log in";	[30]: "To top";	[33]: "Contents";

content:
Thought: The screenshot shows the Cambridge Dictionary +Plus section with an ongoing Easy Animals Quiz. The score is 1 out of 6 questions answered correctly. The current question is about identifying the animal in the image, which is a rat. The answer option "horse" (labeled [27]) is displayed, but it does not match the image. I need to click on the correct answer option if available. The element labeled [26] is the "Next" button, which I can click after selecting the correct answer.

Action: Click 25
